Vlrill be brought dovm in the course of the next few years. This is not the

draft of a trade charter was drawn up, but still those countries not
participating were necessary to make the organization a going concern. A meeting vms therefore called in Havana to consider the text of the
charter drafted at Geneva. You will remember that on November 15th I went there, ~~d we thought the meeting would be finished at the beginning of Janua~. We have since found out that things do not go as fast as
planned. First it was extended to the middle of January, then to the end
of Ja.l1uary, then to the middle of February, then to the end of February,
and now we hope to finish the conference on March 25th. A great deal
however, has been accomplished. There has been a complete revision of
the Geneva draft, and as a result of trade discussions, negotiations,  (
MAO.l' tlDO: and compromise, we have agreed on a charter that will actually mean a great (\ t,"d) improvement in trade relations allover the world. This is very important

ani it provides for safeguarding the interest of the Baal{ from the investors'

them that should be given to investors of capital in underdeveloped countries.
The most important features in my opinion are that the I.T.O. will be set
going, we figure, in a year 1 s time, and will require three years to get
going.- Still it actually completes the work in the field of U.N. activity
because now we have F.A.O. taking care of the problem of food and disposing
of possible surpluses in the world; we have the Fund stabilizing the currencieE
of the world, and the Bank for Reconstruction and Development. We will now

tative restrictions, without which plans of the Fund would have had to be

no loans of a sound nature can be made. P~other question about the Havana
Charter is that it is a very important piece of international legislation
in the economic field. I had planned to be able simply to look after the
Bank's interest, but I found myself appointed delegate for the Cuban Govern- ment, and that I could be more useful to the Bank by helping at the I.T.O.
conference than just come to Washington, where I was being represented by

Havana Charter. In this general agreement signed by 16 countries at Geneva,
